episodes.title: Baptized at 9. Pioneering at 12. Now Living Life Unapologetically: Courtney’s JW Experience. #exjw
episodes.description:
In this DESPITE interview, Courtney shares what it was really like growing up in the Jehovah’s Witness organization as a child — baptized young, pioneering early, and trying to make sense of it all.

Courtney opens up about:

The pressure and expectations placed on her from a young age

Her experience pioneering at just 12 years old

The moments that sparked her “wake-up” journey

The courage it took to finally leave the organization

How she rebuilt her confidence, identity, and freedom

This is more than an ex-JW story — it’s a reminder that you are allowed to evolve, question, heal, and live authentically, no matter where you started.

💬 If Courtney’s journey resonates with you, let her know in the comments.
📌 You can also connect with her in her Facebook group:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1971188659608437/

And don’t forget to like, subscribe, and share to help more people find freedom-focused conversations like this one.

✨ Thank you for supporting stories that deserve to be heard.
Interested in sharing your own DESPITE experience? Email me at stillthesametee@gmail.com

episodes.title: Jehovah’s Witnesses & the Food Stamp Pause: Who’s Helping the “JW Faithful”?
episodes.description:
Many Jehovah’s Witnesses depend on food stamps — and with the recent pause, thousands are feeling the strain.

But here’s the question: Where is the support from the Watchtower?

Despite being a billion-dollar organization, there are no clear programs to help struggling members — unlike churches that have expanded food pantries and outreach. In this video, we look at the human impact, the organizational wealth gap, and what this moment reveals about community and care.

💬 Join the conversation:

Should religious organizations help their members in times of crisis?

What does true community support look like when faith and finances collide?

🔔 Subscribe for honest discussions about faith, freedom, and the systems that shape our lives.

#JehovahsWitnesses #Watchtower #FoodStampCrisis #FaithAndMoney #JWFaithful #SameOleTee

📌 Enjoy this type of content? Be sure to check out my full Ex-JW playlist for more conversations like this.

episodes.title: From prominent JW family to a better life on his own terms : Jean's Journey Out of JWs (Part 1)
episodes.description:
In this first part of his story, Jean opens up about growing up in a well-known Haitian Jehovah’s Witness family, serving as a ministerial servant, and even spending time at Bethel. Behind the structure and status, he wrestled with deep questions about faith and life.

In this candid conversation, he shares what it took to start thinking for himself and choosing a better life — one built on truth, not fear.

🎙 Watch Part 1 now, and stay tuned for Part 2 where Jean shares what life looks like after leaving.

episodes.title: As a JW, I Got to Experience Paradise in This System… No LIE! #exjw #storytime #paradise
episodes.description:
People often ask, “Wasn’t there at least one good thing about your time as a Jehovah’s Witness?”
And honestly… yeah, there was.

As a JW, I attended an international convention in Hawaii — the one time I actually did experience paradise in this system.

In this video, I’m sharing how that trip came about, the so-called “qualifications” to attend (and the irony behind them), and what it taught me about how things can look one way but be something else entirely.

💬 Tell me in the comments — what’s one good thing that came from something you’ve outgrown?

#JehovahsWitness #ExJW #Storytime #SameOleTee #ParadiseInThisSystem

episodes.title: Leaving Jehovah’s Witnesses: 3 Struggles I Never Expected! #exjw #lifeafterjws  #exjwcommunity
episodes.description:
Leaving Jehovah’s Witnesses was just the beginning—what came after was even harder than I expected. In this video, I’m opening up about the three biggest struggles I faced:

✨ The confusion of figuring out what I actually believed about a higher power
✨ Rebuilding my self-esteem and learning it’s okay to take up space in this world
✨ The loneliness of not having a community that truly understood my journey

If you’ve left the JWs—or are thinking about it—you might see yourself in my story. You are not alone. 💜

👉 If this resonates with you, share in the comments the struggles you’ve faced after leaving. Let’s build the community many of us wish we had.

episodes.title: What Do Romance Scammers & Jehovah’s Witnesses Have in Common? I couldn't unsee it after watching!
episodes.description:
What do romance scammers and Jehovah’s Witnesses have in common? More than you’d think. Both use love bombing—and it’s not as harmless as it looks.

Love bombing feels amazing at first—constant attention, overwhelming kindness, and the sense that you finally belong. But there’s a darker side. In relationships, it can be a tool for control. And in groups like Jehovah’s Witnesses, it’s used to pull people in and keep them there.

In this video, I share how love bombing works, why it’s so dangerous, and how to spot the signs before it’s too late.

⏩ If you’ve ever experienced love bombing—whether in dating, friendships, or religion—this one’s for you.

🔔 Don’t forget to like, share, and subscribe for more conversations on healing, growth, and freedom.

#LoveBombing #JehovahsWitnesses #RomanceScam #ToxicRelationships #ExJW #HealingJourney #Netflix #LoveConRevenge

📌 Enjoy this type of content? Be sure to check out my full Ex-JW playlist for more conversations like this.

episodes.title: Gaslighting in Disguise: The JW Use of the word Privilege. They label everything as a privilege!
episodes.description:
Jehovah’s Witnesses love to use the word ‘privilege’ — but what if it isn’t really a privilege at all?

In this video, I break down how the organization uses the word ‘privilege’ to reframe burdens as honors — and why that’s a form of gaslighting. From Kingdom Hall cleaning to last-minute talk assignments and financially draining “opportunities,” I’ll show you how this tactic makes members doubt their own feelings, ignore their limits, and stay silent.

 A real privilege uplifts you. What JWs call a privilege often leaves you drained, guilty, and questioning your worth. That’s not spirituality — that’s manipulation.

🙋🏽‍♀️ Have you ever been told something was a ‘privilege’ that didn’t feel like one? Share your story in the comments.

If you found this video helpful, don’t forget to like, subscribe, and share it with someone who needs to hear this.

episodes.title: Are Jehovah’s Witnesses a Doomsday Cult? Let’s Talk About It!
episodes.description:
Jehovah’s Witnesses are known for their door-to-door ministry, but what many don’t realize is just how deeply rooted their beliefs are in doomsday predictions. In this video, I break down why some people—including ex-members and cult experts—believe the organization fits the mold of a high-control, doomsday group.

From failed end-time prophecies to fear-based teachings about Armageddon, we’re unpacking it all. Are Jehovah’s Witnesses a doomsday cult in disguise? Or is that label too extreme? Let’s talk about it.

If you’ve ever been a JW—or love someone who is—this one’s for you.

episodes.title: JWs Are the "Happiest" Unhappy People I've Ever Known 🤦🏽‍♀️
episodes.description:
They say Jehovah’s Witnesses are the happiest people on Earth—but if that’s true, why are they always so angry in the comments? Calling people out of their names and straight crashing out....

In this video, I’m sharing my thoughts on the contradiction between the polished image and the often painful reality within the JW world. From waiting on “the end” to shunning joy in the present, let’s talk about why so many Jehovah’s Witnesses appear happy on the outside... but are silently struggling inside.

If you’ve ever been a JW—or love someone who is—this one’s for you.

We share openly about the emotions, misunderstandings, and the love that kept us connected even when we didn’t see eye to eye.

episodes.title: Jehovah's Witness Beliefs Are Changing Again...Let's Talk About It! #toasting #pants #beards
episodes.description:
Toasts, pants, beards—oh my! In today’s video, we’re diving into some of the latest changes coming out of the Jehovah’s Witness organization. Believe it or not, Witnesses can now make toasts in certain settings. Add that to the recent acceptance of women wearing pants and men growing beards, and you’ve got a whole new look for a group known for its strict rules.

As a former JW and adult convert, I’m sharing my thoughts on what these sudden shifts mean—not just on paper, but for the mindset of active members. Are they sitting in the meetings wondering, “What was all the fuss about?” Let’s talk about the emotional toll, the mental games, and the way these rule reversals affect real people.

Were you ever counseled for something that’s now “okay”? 💬 Share your experience in the comments.

What do you think these changes mean for the future of the organization?

👀 Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe if you're here for honest conversations and real talk from someone who’s been there.

#JehovahsWitnesses #ExJW #JWBeliefs #ReligiousTrauma #CultSurvivor #JWChanges #WatchtowerSociety

episodes.title: Smurfs, Yoga & Thrift Stores—Oh My! JW Superstitions I Learned as an JW Adult Convert!
episodes.description:
When I became a Jehovah’s Witness as an adult, I thought I understood what I was signing up for—Bible study, ministry, moral living. But I was not prepared for the strange superstitions I would hear along the way…

From Smurfs being labeled demonic, to warnings about thrift store shopping, and even fear around yoga and fantasy books—it felt like stepping into a world of spiritual folklore.

In this video, I’m sharing the most unexpected beliefs I encountered after converting. If you’re an adult convert too, or just curious about the lesser-known side of JW culture, this one’s for you.

💬 Drop your thoughts in the comments—Did you hear any of these? Did you grow up with them? Let’s talk about it.

📌 Enjoy this type of content? Be sure to check out my full Ex-JW Playlist for more conversations like this.

episodes.title: JW Reality + Expectations: Meetings, Ministry… Even While Battling Cancer!
episodes.description:
In this video, I’m discussing a topic that rarely gets talked about—how Jehovah’s Witnesses are expected to keep up with their spiritual routines even when battling serious illnesses like cancer.

Rest and healing are basic human needs—but in the organization, there’s often guilt, judgment, and pressure to “do more,” even when someone’s body is failing. I’ll share what I’ve seen and why it’s time to have an honest conversation.

✨ Share your story or thoughts below.

episodes.title: The Hidden Cost of Full-Time Service in JW Culture...spiritual privilege vs financial burden?
episodes.description:
Many Jehovah’s Witnesses are taught that full-time service—like Bethel, pioneering, or missionary work—is the highest privilege. But what’s rarely talked about is the real cost behind the scenes.

In this video, I share two powerful, personal stories I witnessed firsthand while I was a Jehovah’s Witness. These stories reveal how families often sacrifice their finances, security, and future to support loved ones in full-time service… all in the name of “spiritual goals.”

👉 If you’ve ever wondered what life is really like behind the curtain of full-time service—or if you’ve felt the pressure to give up everything for the organization—this video is for you.

💬 Let’s talk about it. Share your thoughts or your own experience in the comments.

episodes.title: JW Tattletale Culture: How Snitching Is Encouraged in the Name of “Love”
episodes.description:
In this video, I’m exposing the snitch culture within the Jehovah’s Witness organization — a culture where reporting on your friends, family, and even your own spouse is not just accepted, it’s expected.

From “keeping the congregation clean” to fearing bloodguilt, many Jehovah’s Witnesses grow up in a climate of surveillance and fear disguised as love. Let’s talk about how this mindset affects trust, relationships, and mental health.

💬 Have you ever been reported in the congregation? Or felt pressure to report someone else? Share your experience in the comments.

episodes.title: Putting on The “New Personality” in JW Culture it's NOT what you think it is...JUST LET ME BE ME!
episodes.description:
What does it really mean to "put on the new personality" in Jehovah’s Witness culture?

In this video, I’m sharing my TRUTH behind this seemingly innocent doctrine and how it impacts real lives. From how you dress and groom yourself… to what movies you watch, what career path you choose, and even how you express your personality—this expectation goes far beyond simply making spiritual growth.

I talk about how the “new personality” was used to suppress individuality, promote conformity, and control behavior—especially for women.

episodes.title: Why So Many JW Wives Never Become Mothers | The Silent Sacrifice
episodes.description:
This Mother’s Day Weekend, I’m shedding light on a painful and often overlooked reality within the Jehovah’s Witness community—why so many married women never become mothers.

In this video, I explore three key factors I believe contribute to the high number of childless JW wives:

✔️ The constant warning that the end is near
✔️ The pressure to pioneer instead of parent
✔️ Husbands placing “spiritual ambition” above family life

For many, the choice to remain childless wasn’t truly a choice—it was obedience masked as faithfulness.

episodes.title: Is A Disassociation Letter the Right Choice? Weighing Your JW Exit Options.
episodes.description:
Are you thinking about submitting a disassociation letter to officially leave the Jehovah’s Witnesses? In this video, I’ll break down what disassociation really means, how it compares to fading and disfellowshipping, and the emotional, spiritual, and social costs of each.

Whether you’re just beginning to question things or already halfway out the door, this video is here to help you weigh your JW exit options and move forward on your terms.

episodes.title: What They Don’t Tell You About Being a Jehovah's Witness Wife...It's not just you, him & God!
episodes.description:
Being a Jehovah’s Witness wife isn’t just about submission and spirituality—it’s about navigating a marriage that often includes a fourth party: THE ELDERS.

In this video, I’m sharing the hidden struggles many JW wives face behind closed doors. From the overwhelming influence of elders on marital decisions to the emotional and spiritual pressure to stay silent, this is the side of “JW marriage” you won’t hear being discussed openly.

Whether you’re still in, fading, or completely out, this video is for every woman who ever felt unseen in her own marriage.

episodes.title: ExJW Birthday Confessions: Regret, Freedom & Turning 50 + Vlog of my 50th Bday Cruise!
episodes.description:
In this video, I share why I accepted the Jehovah’s Witness teachings on birthdays, how I’ve come to regret that decision, and what it feels like to finally reclaim this simple joy and reminder that we are "still here".

The second half is a 9-minute vlog from my 50th birthday cruise on Virgin Voyages...I hope you enjoy it!

Whether you're an ExJW, someone on a spiritual journey, or just curious about life after high-control religion, I hope this resonates.

episodes.title: Is His Marriage Built on Love or Religious Fear?! Responding to married JW man's comment. #jw #exjw
episodes.description:
In this video, I respond to a comment from a married Jehovah’s Witness man who says he remains faithful to his wife because he doesn’t want to disappoint Jehovah.  This raises an important question—is his commitment truly about love, or is it based on religious fear?

As someone who has experienced the JW mindset firsthand, I explore the implications of this kind of thinking, the impact of high-control religion on relationships, and whether obedience-driven faithfulness is sustainable.

🔥 What do you think? Does this sound like love, or does it reflect the pressure Jehovah’s Witnesses face in their marriages? Drop your thoughts in the comments!

episodes.title: 4 Things Women MUST Consider Before Becoming a Jehovah’s Witness #exjw #freedom #womansworth
episodes.description:
Are you a woman thinking about becoming a Jehovah’s Witness? Before making that decision, there are 4 major things you should consider that could have a lasting impact on your life. 

In this video, I discuss:
🔸 Marriage Limitations – Why dating and marrying within the organization can be restrictive.
🔸 Discouragement from Having Children – How women are often told that bringing children into this "wicked world" isn’t wise.
🔸 Your Free Time Won't Be Yours – The expectation to devote your time to "Kingdom interests" over just normal regualr actvities.
🔸 Career & Education Limits – How higher education and career ambitions are often discouraged in favor of organizational service.

👉 Have you or someone you know experienced this? Let’s talk about it in the comments!
